intro: Dodecatheon conjugens, commonly known as the paired squirrel corn, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Dodecatheon conjugens is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
